p: Compounds were added at different concentrations (30, 60 and 100 µg/mL) after the infection and maintained for the following 24 h. Viral replication was measured by means of HAU/mL. As shown in Table 4, compounds furanodienone ( 1) and curzerene ( 3) were effective at 60 and 100 µg/mL, even though the latter concentration was quite toxic for both compounds. In particular, for compound 1, the viral titer was of 6 and 2 HAU/mL, at 60 and 100 µg/mL, respectively; for compound 3, the viral titer was of 3 at 60 µg/mL, while no viral titer was observed at a concentration of 100 µg/mL. With regard to 2, no inhibition was observed at any concentrations used (data not shown).
